document.masterDocTitle: Rearrangements in some species groups of Amblycerus Thunberg, 1815 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Bruchinae) including keys, description of a new species, new host plant and distributional records

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Rearrangements in some species groups of Amblycerus Thunberg, 1815 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Bruchinae) including keys, description of a new species, new host plant and distributional records

bibRefCitation.refString: Kingsolver, J. M. (1980) Eighteen new species of Bruchidae, principally from Costa Rica, with host records and distributional notes (Insecta: Coleoptera). Proceedings of the biological Society of Washington, 93 (1), 229 - 283.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types examined .
Paratype deposited in AMNH , 1 male , with labels: Rabinal, Guate.\

; F.
Measurements . Paratype (Salama., Guate., AMNH), BL: 9.3 mm; BW: 4.7 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution ( Fig. 121 )
. Mexico , El Salvador , Guatemala , Honduras ( new country record ), Costa Rica and Panama .

Life History . According to Kingsolver (1980) , the oviposition by
A. spondiae
is apparently on fruits or endocarps on the ground. Adults have been observed on clumps of
Spondias
endocarps that had passed through the alimentary tract of monkeys, and on endocarps of
Hippomane
from which the fleshy exocarp had been sloughed off.

Host Plants (Tab. II) .
Anacardiaceae
:
Spondias mombin
L.,
Spondias radlkoferi Donn.
-Sm.
Boraginaceae
:
Cordia dodecandra
DC.
Capparaceae
:
Capparis
sp. ( new record ).
Euphorbiaceae
:
Hippomane mancinella
L.
Rhamnaceae
:
Ziziphus mexicanus .
